intro: Kentiopsis piersoniorum, commonly known as the Pierson's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Kentiopsis piersoniorum is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
